text:
I think its a really important point that <@ULJBEFSJJ> made earlier - has any of this dissatisfaction and malcontent been actively raised with the person concerned. If they are blissfully unaware of the issues they are creating then its very hard for them to address them. Perhaps this individual does lack a degree of self awareness or perhaps they just don't realise where they have been going wrong. May be they didn't quite take or have the time to understand the dynamic of the existing team.
I am sure you've raised it with them but it would certainly lean in your favour if you are able to demonstrate that there has been an element of proactivity on the team's part to surface the issue in a constructive way. I understand this can be difficult to navigate.

text:
What’s their product like? Do they have a plan to grow 5x within 3 years or is it an aspirational goal? How much $$$ have they allocated to marketing? What’s their burn rate? How much runway do they have? Those are some of the answers you’ll need to determine your likelihood of success.

About the lack of search queries. Keep in mind that keyword volume is a really poor indicator for too many reason to list here (I’ve written about it on the MarketMuse blog). It’s extremely rare not to find any relevant searches, unless you’re operating in a blue ocean, which could be a good thing. With $1M ARR they have achieved some semblance of product market fit, so they are addressing a pain point that someone must be searching for. Also keep in mind that Search is just one channel, it’s not your only channel. 

So is it possible to grow at the rate they want? Yes. But you will need a budget even if you’re not doing paid. At $600 ACV you’re going to need to reach lot of people.

It’s extremely rare not to find any relevant searches, unless you’re operating in a blue ocean, which could be a good thing. Also keep in mind that Search is just one channel, it’s not your only channel.

text:
Looking for a role for my partner.

My partner came into my business to work with me. We have done some amazing work together, made it through COVID, and published our first book. Most thought it was a terrible idea, and it has been amazing to spend so much time together.

COVID put some huge cramps in our business plans, I think that is universal. The book is helping, but we are exploring her going back to work for a company. Benefits alone make this make sense as anything affordable for me as a small business owner is not usable and some stability on that front is nice.

She is an excellent content person and editor. She edited my first book and is now editing the audio version. She is capable of many things in the content space.

I have sent her the superpath website so she can begin to look at spots on there, but wanted to see if anyone knew of other potential roles.

Anyone know of anything?
